body: I know that they can't remove posts, but what about individual comments? I assume the upvote system is supposed to do it's work instead?
body_html: I know that they can't remove posts, but what about individual comments? I assume the upvote system is supposed to do it's work instead?
title: Can guildmasters remove individual comments in posts?

body:
They cannot purge comments from their posts. They will remain visible. The community can upvote/downvote them to affect the comment's visibility. 

If comments break Ruqqus TOS, it can be flagged for admin review and they'll action it, if they deem it actionable.
body_html:
They cannot purge comments from their posts. They will remain visible. The community can upvote/downvote them to affect the comment's visibility.

If comments break Ruqqus TOS, it can be flagged for admin review and they'll action it, if they deem it actionable.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body: Ah ok, thanks. I saw a downvoted comment which later disappeared, and I was a bit concerned but the poster himself must have removed it
